name: Scout O'Beirne
text: I absolutely ADORE this gym! We've only been climbing there for a couple of months, but the staff is super friendly & inviting and they are also VERY covid-19 safe (everyone is wearing a mask, frequently cleaning of popular spots, capacity limit). They turn the gym over about every month (in waves) so there is always a new project to be had. They use a different grading system than the V-scale, so it's a bit hard to know where you fall on the v-scale. Overall, a great spot and friendly for all levels of climbing.

name: Lawrence Osefoh
text:
Really polished feel just outside of Birmingham AL!!

Great setting, diversity of movement and wall angles! A well-equipped training section and plenty of training walls (Moon Board, Tension Board, spray wall) means there is something for everyone and then a few more options.

name: Erik Pasco
text: We love our local climbing gym. Lots of variety and challenges for all skill levels.

name: Myres Allen
text: Before COVID, this was one of my favorite places to climb in Birmingham. However, I have Cystic Fibrosis and I cannot wear a mask, especially while exerting myself and working out. Birmingham Boulders has not be understanding of this and the owner has made me wear a mask when I have gone there. I do not climb here anymore because I simply cannot for the sake of my health. High Point climbing has a cleaner facility and they have been very understanding of my unique medical condition. They also have a greater variety of training and climbing equipment and better hours for the same price as Birmingham Boulders

name: Baby Gamer
text: The sussy baka service is great.

name: Jeff Jones
text: Great facilities and staff. Top notch and really consistent setting - twice a week! They also have really cool community events. You can tell this bouldering gym is locally owned and the owners are rock climbers! B2 leadership handled the COVID-19 challenge better than just about any place I’ve seen. Also just a really fun place to be… There’s always a great vibe with other members and guests.

name: Ashlee H
text: A great bouldering gym whether you are a beginner or a skilled climber there are always a bunch of routes to climb.

name: Austin Montoya
text:
Stopped in for a short session while visiting family in the area. Online waiver was simple to fill out the night before. Easy to find the location.

Staff working the front desk was very helpful. She did a great job taking the necessary COVID precautions, and gave me a brief but helpful tour of the facilities.

The routes here use a 1-5 "dot" grading scale, plus a smiley face for beginner routes. 1 dot is easy; > 4 dots, I'm not even sure Spider Man could do. + sign is in-between dot "grades". Simple enough, and similar to the color / ski slope systems I have seen elsewhere.

Most routes seemed to be in the 2-3+ range. Normally I am a v3-v5 climber, depending on the route and gym. I was able to do every 2 I tried, and one 2+. These routes are tough!

The setting was done well, with a strong mix of holds and problem types. I wish I was good enough to do some of the harder ones! They looked really fun. But even their 2 dots had some challenge to them, and forced some flagging, hooks, dynos I wasn't expecting on initial read. The geometry was comparable to Walltopia, very curvy, lots of inversion, which definitely adds to the difficulty in many cases.

The Forge area looked amazing. Moon boards, spray walls, campus walls, it was truly a sight to behold. Biggest I've seen anywhere. Unfortunately I did not have time to train in this part of the gym but rest assured I will be firing up the moonboard app and failing miserably here next time I'm in Birmingham area.

Overall, I'd say B2 is pretty top-notch. Has something for all experience levels and would recommend to anyone who's interested in climbing.

name: Cameron Boyter
text: Weekly rotating sets, all the tools for progression from beginner to to expert

name: Brandon Baradell
text: Great staff and challenging boulder problems!

name: Arthur Brookshire
text: Love the environment. Good personal employees.

name: Sky Jett
text: My kids had a blast climbing here. Be sure to wear tennis shoes if you wanna save on shoe rental. Harness rental and day passes for my 9, 11, and 14 year old (plus one shoe rental) was around $60. The restrooms are clean and they have a water fountain (BIG plus since we forgot drinks). The staff is super friendly and helpful. There are some couches and chairs, and an area with tables for birthday parties. There are lots of varying challenge walls. The dots on the wall correspond to difficulty levels (one dot=easy, two dot=medium difficulty, etc). It would be nice if they had an area for little kids as my 3 year old got a little bored and I had to keep her out of other climbers' way while trying to take some pictures of the other three. I probably won't bring the youngest with me next time. Overall a great place.

name: Noah Smith
text: Wonderful staff clean and plenty of rocks! Also the best training room I've seen.

name: Zachary Giddens
text: Great business that values all of their customers.

name: Susanne Carrier
text: A great experience on our first visit!  Birmingham Boulders has a variety of walls to climb for every experience level.  Very friendly and welcoming staff.  Our family had a great afternoon at Birmingham Boulders.  If you are seeking a fun time for the family, definitely give them a try.

name: Dan Fenner
text: Fully equipped bouldering gym plus a robust training/workout area with a friendly atmosphere. Uniform flooring design with no need for modular mats, very comfortable falls. I enjoyed the route setting style and appreciate the diversity of problems. They had everything from soft slab warm ups to 25 move roof problems. Taylor was working the desk when I arrived and he was very friendly and helpful.

name: Rob Sullivan
text: I love this place. The staff are super helpful and friendly. Great vibes for a beginner like me. I have several friends who have started going and I decided to join when I moved back into town this weekend. Every time my hands and forearms give out I still can't wait to get back there.

name: that guy
text: Absolutely loved it

name: Joseph Bahder
text:
So much awesome climbing!

There's really some of everything here from slab to 70 degrees overhung! Everything is brand new and in tip top condition. The staff is awesome, laid back, and genuinely helpful.

The whole place is just so well done. Really a bouldering gym paradise.

name: Jordan Peebles
text: Brought my family here which includes two small girls ages 5 and 7. We had an absolute blast, there is climbing areas for all age groups and difficulties. Staff was extremely helpful and inviting, couldn’t have asked for a better experience!

name: Austin Davis
text: Birmingham Boulders is definitely my favorite climbing gym. It has a huge variety of routes at all difficulty levels. The facility is always clean and well-maintained, basically what I've come to expect from the good folks who brought us First Avenue Rocks. And that brings me to the most important thing about it: the people are amazing. The community of climbers and staff members are really supportive and inclusive, and just all around good people. Definitely check it out.

name: William Hightower
text: Amazing state-of-the-art climbing gym in Birmingham, AL. Great for families, kids, and serious climbers alike. Parts of this gym are second to none!

name: Rajan Ananthan
text: Very fun place. There are a variety of climbing walls based on difficulty level. You won't find a wider selection in Birmingham. Great customer service.

name: Jeffrey Bagley
text: My wife and I took the intro class, and were honestly terrified of bouldering, but our instructor,Joe, was so awesome and we totally loved our experience. Hoping to come back very soon!

name: Markham Tuck
text: Best climbing facility in the Birmingham area. Climbing is a fun way to get in a workout & if it is fun then you will continue coming back!

name: Caleb Wilson
text: Great gym for bouldering. Sometimes the music is too loud tho especially in the Forge

name: Lukas
text:
I really like the openness and lighting in that place, it's very clean and light, contrary to a lot of bouldering places (and even to their other bouldering place in downtown Birmingham).

It's cool that this gym is connected to "The Forge" as well, where there is another overhang to climb on as well as a system wall and multiple training walls -- campus board and so on. There is also a small weight lifting area.

I am taking off one star as I felt the route setting to be a bit unimaginative. Let me explain: While there is a fair variation of grades (on their own system which is easy to understand -- one dot very easy, five dots insanely hard), I found the problems to be not as varied and imaginative as other gyms I have seen. Especially the "easier" problems, one and two dots +, are rather ladder-like, but with the holds just getting smaller and smaller with rising difficulty. I think it could be beneficial to have more problems using hooking or mantling for the easier grades, which would make it more interesting for the non-pros.

name: Keith _
text: My biggest complaint is that I can't give them 6 stars. Great facilities and even better customer service

name: Nicholaus Carrea
text: Would have given this place 4 stars except the music they are playing right now as I sit here, and since I've been here for 45 minutes, is old, slow, depressing and terrible.  It's a cross between a classic rock station and smooth jazz.  Routes are just ok.

name: Jamal Bryant
text: Great place, had a great time very.A good place to go and chill and be away from and madness, and has a gym where u can work out.Also great staff, just the whole place made it feel as if I was at home..

name: Adam Elliott
text: It's awesome. Very impressed . Good job Joe

name: Mike's Mix
text: One of the best gyms of its kind in the country and the staff are friendly and helpful

name: sean williamson
text: This facility is bar none the best in the Southeast. It is huge with boulder problems from beginner to advanced, there is also auto belays for some routes. A new set of routes are set every Thursday and all sets include problems for all users and skill levels. The Forge is an attached 24hr training facility/gym. They have training walls with 70,50,15 degree decline. There is also a Tension board, Moon board, Red board all for personal training as well as a campus board and multiple set of hang boards. This is a full gym so they have everything from free weights to ellipticals. There is also a full bathroom with optional lockers so you can keep your stuff secure and clean off before heading out after a killer workout.

name: Amanda Dowdy
text: Clean and awesome! Very helpful employees and a wonderful experience!

name: Willie Thompson
text: Awesome extension from first ave loved it

name: Jeff Williams
text: Love this place. Been going for several months now.

name: David Knott
text: Great staff, routes, gym and people!

name: Izz Noland
text: Great addition to the bouldering community in Birmingham!

name: Courtney Gorsuch
text: Very helpful guys at the desk

name: Matthew Walton
text: I cant climb, David just stop

resp.text:
Hey Matthew, we don't know who David is, or what he keeps doing, but Birmingham Boulders believes in you. You can climb, Matthew!

Feel free to hit us up at info@firstaverocks.com, or 205.201.4616. If you want to give climbing another shot, we've got your spot!  - B2/FAR

name: Pernal Tom
text: Nice Gym

name: Amol Sura
text: Chill vibe, awesome people

name: Fallon Burton
text: Loved it

name: Jerry Ivey
text: Fantastic
